resources.string: What is a Bitcoin transaction locktime?
The time taken to send the transaction from your mobile to the nearest full node
The earliest time a transaction can be included in a block
The time taken to get a transaction confirmed in a block
The ability to backdate a transaction in the blockchain
How many Bitcoins will there ever be?
21 million in 2140
21 million in 2020
14 million 2015
23 million in 2140
What is the Blockchain?
A centralised database
A set of transactions
A set of blocks containing transactions
The Bitcoin software protocol
What is the Blocksize Limit (2015)?
1 MB
It varies according to supply and demand
8 MB
2 MB
What is Cold Storage?
Switching your phone off as you make a transaction
Running a Bitcoin node offline
Cooling your mining equipment with extra fans to stop over heating
Storing your Private key offline
What is Green Listing?
A way of making mining more efficient
A wallet address that has no formal identity attached
A private key that is publicly known
Linking someone\'s identity to their Bitcoin address
What is a Private Key in Bitcoin?
The password to your account
Performing a transaction anonymously
The secret number that generates your public address
The ability to access the Blockchain
How does a miner choose which transactions go into the next block?
Lucky Dip!
A balance between transaction age and size - with high priority transactions given allocated space
All the transactions with the highest fees above 10 Satoshi
All the transactions it can
How many blocks are need before a generation transaction is released?
What is an advantage of Bitcoin?
It\'s in-built Inflation
The total money supply is pre-determined
It\'s the fastest confirming crypto currency
Your grandma will be totally ok to use it to buy groceries
What is a Mining Pool?
A syndicate of miners grouping together to lower the volatility of returns
A syndicate of miners grouping together to increase their returns
A syndicate of miners profits from 1 day of mining Bitcoin
A refreshing place to cool off after a long hard days mining
What is SHA-256?
The hashing algorithm used in Litecoin
The hashing algorithm used in both Litecoin and Bitcoin
The hashing algorithm used in Bitcoin and some other crypto currencies
A hashing algorithm used to generate a private key from a public key
What is Bitcoin Transaction Malleability?
The ability to send transactions anywhere
A hack used to expose vulnerabilities in Mt Gox
A way of bending Bitcoin to your will
The ability to send a transaction only if two people agree
What is Bitcoin Cloud Mining?
Running your mining computer with extra cooling
Outsourcing the day to day maintenance of mining to a third party
A way of pooling miners to generate higher returns
A bias in the Bitcoin protocol to nodes placed closer together
What is Merged Mining?
A way of mining Bitcoin with two processors
A way of mining Bitcoin for one block and then dogecoin for the next
Mining Bitcoin with lots of other people and sharing the block reward
Mining Bitcoin and another same algorothm Crypto at the same time
What is Scrypt?
A memory hard hashing technique that uses less RAM to store variables than SHA-256
A memory soft hashing technique that uses less RAM to store variables than SHA-256
A memory soft hashing technique that uses more RAM to store variables than SHA-256
A memory hard hashing technique that uses more RAM to store variables than SHA-256
What is Multi Pool Mining?
Jumping from winning Bitcoin mining pool as each reward comes in
Combining the power of multiple hashing factories to make a super pool
Increasing your hashrate with others to perform a 51% attack
Mining the most profitable crypto after each block
What is a Bitcoin Vanity Address?
A way of keeping your address secret by writing it backwards
An public address that holds some value due to the characters in it
An address that masks the true purpose of where the Bitcoins are being sent
An address printed on a piece of paper
What is a BIPS?
A Bitcoin Initial Protocol Setting
The Bitcoin Image Police
A Bitcoin Improvement Proposal
Kanye West\'s new baby
What is a Bitcoin double spend?
Sending Bitcoin from one wallet to another
Trying to spend the same Bitcoin twice
When a Mining node generates a false transaction to delay its competitors
Generating two Bitcoins from mining fees
What is a Bitcoin Fork?
A kitchen utensil made of Bitcoin
A Temporary Blockchain Lack of Consensus
The Next Block in the Blockchain
The Largest Transaction in the Block
What is a difficulty adjustment in Bitcoin?
The method of rewarding miners according to their effort in proof of work
A mining pool that increases its hashing power to over 51%
A tool to decrease the block time below five minutes
A way of adjusting the proof of work requirement to keep the block time at 10 minutes
What is Mining in Bitcoin?
The process of looking at data on the blockchain
Keeping the blockchain on your computer
Sending multiple transactions into the network (Flooding)
Securing the network through Proof of Work
What is the Genesis Block?
The first block in the Blockchain
A famous block that hardcoded a hash of the book of Genesis into the Blockchain
The first block after each block halving
The first transaction in each block
What is a Bitcoin Block?
The main community behind Bitcoin
A virtual brick used in Minecraft
A Bitcoin transaction
A set of Bitcoin transactions
What is a Coinbase or Generation Transaction?
The reward miners get for solving a block
The largest transaction in a block
The average time for each Bitcoin transaction to be sent
The last transaction to be included in a block
Why is mining becoming centralised?
Economies of Scale & Moore\'s Law
Government Regulation
The Bitcoin Foundation\'s guidelines
The Blockchain getting smaller
What is Proof of Work?
A way of proving that Bitcoins have been sent and received from your wallet
A tool used in mining to generate the next transaction
The competition between miners to find the correct hash
The competition between miners to not fully disclose transactions
What is Cold Storage?
Switching your phone off as you make a transaction
Running a Bitcoin node offline
Cooling your mining equipment with extra fans to stop over heating
Storing your Private key offline
What is a Premine?
A way of confirming a transaction before it has been sent to the network
Miners starting to mine a block before the last block has finished
A way of allocating crypto currency prior to public release and is generally frowned upon
A way of generating crypto currency through mining many cryptos at once
How long is a Bitcoin Block?
660 Seconds
10 Minutes
As long as a piece of string
Generally 10 minutes
